snippet: Two new books tell the story of the historic upset at golf’s 1955 U.S. Open, and a third serves as a primer for course newcomers and veterans alike.
abstract: Bill Scheft reviews books The Longest Shot: Jack Fleck, Ben Hogan, and Pro Golf's Greatest Upset at the 1955 US Open by Neil Sagabiel, The Upset: Jack Fleck's Incredible Victory Over Ben Hogan at the US Open by Al Barkow and On Par: The Everyday Golfer's Survival Guide by Bill Pennington.
lead_paragraph: Two new books tell the story of the historic upset at golf’s 1955 U.S. Open, and a third serves as a primer for course newcomers and veterans alike.

headline.main: Upsets on, and Ground Rules for, the Links
